page.title: 13BASINGSTOKE CANAL BRIDGES
page.content: There are 9 bridges over the canal in the Dogmersfield and Crookham Village area. Two are swing bridges,four are on footpaths (Sandy Hill,Sprat's Hatch,Blacksmith's,Coxmoor) and three carry minor roads across the canal (Double,Chequers,Poulter's). Most of the bridges have been restored during restoration of the canal. On the towpath side of the canal west of Blacksmith's Bridge is a 600yard stretch known as 'Great Gabion Wall', which was built as a retaining wall to stabilise a cutting during restoration of the canal.It comprises wire baskets filled with 1500 tons of Oxfordshire stone and cost Â£80,000 to build. Also visible along the canal between Crookham and Dogmersfield are pill- boxes,concrete tank-traps and concrete footings, remnants of defences erected during the Second World War.
